projectPurpose: To provide a simple, secure, and cross-platform solution for transferring files directly between nearby devices using ad hoc WiFi, without needing an existing network infrastructure or internet connection, similar to Apple's AirDrop.
mainFeatures: Cross-platform file transfer (Android, iOS, Linux, macOS, Windows)
Uses ad hoc WiFi for direct device-to-device transfer
No existing network infrastructure or internet required
Encrypted file transfer
Optional Bluetooth for connection negotiation

alternatives.name: LocalSend
mainFeatures: File and text sharing over local network
No internet or external servers required
Automatic device discovery on the same network
Uses REST API and HTTPS encryption
User-friendly GUI

alternatives.name: Nearby Share (Quick Share)
mainFeatures: System-level integration on supported platforms
Uses various technologies (Bluetooth, BLE, Wi-Fi Direct, UWB)
Transfers files and content between nearby devices
Can work without internet for direct connections
Contact and device visibility options

alternatives.name: ShareDrop
mainFeatures: Web-based, no installation required
Peer-to-peer file transfer using WebRTC
Works on devices on the same local network
Allows sharing between different networks via rooms
Secure and encrypted connections

alternatives.name: AirDrop
mainFeatures: Native integration within the Apple ecosystem
Uses Bluetooth LE for discovery and Wi-Fi for transfer
Creates ad-hoc network for direct transfer
Simple and intuitive user interface
Secure transfers

alternatives.name: Send Anywhere
mainFeatures: Peer-to-peer file transfer
Uses 6-digit key, QR code, or direct connection
Supports large files
Works over internet or local network
Broad platform support

alternatives.name: SHAREit
mainFeatures: High-speed file transfer
Uses Wi-Fi Direct or local network
Supports various file types
Additional features like phone replicate and video player

mostWellKnownAlternative: Nearby Share / Quick Share (within Android/Windows ecosystems)
marketPositioning: FlyingCarpet is positioned as a privacy-focused, open-source, and truly cross-platform alternative to Apple's AirDrop. Its key differentiator is the ability to create and utilize an ad hoc WiFi network for direct device-to-device file transfer, even when no existing router or network infrastructure is available. This distinguishes it from many alternatives like LocalSend and ShareDrop, which primarily rely on a shared local network. While Nearby Share/Quick Share also offers direct connection capabilities, FlyingCarpet provides a consistent application experience across a broader range of desktop and mobile operating systems, including Linux.
